definition: erhua variant of 苦活[ku3 huo2]

sentences.english: In the end, the workers became used to doing hard work.
sentences.chinese: 最後，工人們終於習慣於幹苦活了。

sentences.english: She was born with a silver spoon in her mouth and has never done a day's hard work in her life.
sentences.chinese: 她出生於富貴人家，一生中從來沒有做過一天的苦活。

sentences.english: It is too much of a fag .
sentences.chinese: 那是一件受不了的苦活。

sentences.english: She earned a rest after all that hard work.
sentences.chinese: 她幹完那些苦活後終於得到了一次休息的機會。

sentences.english: In the end, I got used to doing the hard work.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我終於習慣幹苦活了。

sentences.english: All that hard work really did me in.
sentences.chinese: 那個苦活幹下來真把我累死了。

sentences.english: Building a foundation, it's always bitter first and sweet later.
sentences.chinese: 先從苦活累活做起，打好基礎先苦後甜。

sentences.english: In the end, I got employed to doing the difficult stay.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我終於習慣幹苦活了。

sentences.english: In the end I got used to doing hard work.
sentences.chinese: 最後我終於習慣幹苦活了。

sentences.english: In the end, I got used to doing hard work.
sentences.chinese: 最後，我終於習慣於幹苦活了。

sentences.english: It's a rail pain. But I guess I shouldn't complain.
sentences.chinese: 這的確是份苦活，但是我想我不該抱怨。

definition: erhua variant of 苦活[ku3 huo2]
erhua variant of 重活[zhong4 huo2]
bitter work/hard toil/(loanword) coolie, unskilled Chinese laborer in colonial times
to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
